page.title: 03ECOLOGY
page.content: THIS AREA WAS ORIGINALLY A GLACIAL LAKE WHICH DRAINED THROUGH THE YORK MORRAINE AND BECAME FORESTED.ALDER, BIRCH,ASH AND OAK PREDOMINATED BUT NO VIRGIN FOREST LAND SURVIVES BEING CLEARED IN SAXON AND LATER TIMES FOR AGRICULTURE AND SOME ENCLOSED AND EMPARKED IN THE EIGHTEENTH CENTURY.THE SOIL IS AN ALKALINE, SANDY LOAM WITH PATCHES OF CLAY. THE ENVIRONMENT HAS BEEN AFFECTED BY FARMING METHODS OVER THE CENTURIES WITH THE FLOOD LAND NOW PROVIDING THE ONLY CONTINUOUS WILD HABITAT. CATTLE GRAZE ON THE {INGS}SO SURVIVING WILD PLANT LIFE IS FOUND IN PROFUSION ON THE SLOPING BANKS. SMALL TREE PLANTINGS INCLUDE OAK, ASH, HORNBEAM AND BEECH WITH SOME CONIFERS. WILLOWS AND ALDERS LINE THE WATER COURSES. HEDGEROWS INCLUDE TEN SPECIES OF SHRUB AND SYCAMORE AND WYCHELM. THE ENGLISH ELMS SUCCUMBED TO DISEASE.
